body.p: Nonetheless, the Board identified two aspects of applying the annual cohort requirement to some contracts with intergenerational sharing of risks between policyholders that could increase the costs of applying the requirement and reduce the benefits of the resulting information:

li.p: distinguishing between the effect of risk sharing and the effect of discretion (paragraph BC139L); and
allocating changes in the amount of the entity’s share of the fair value of underlying items between annual cohorts that share in the same pool of underlying items (paragraph BC139M).
